content: /=Clansmen start mumbling, and you are not certain they are on your side.=/
/=He points at everyone pulling trees off the trail and helping others who are injured.=/
/=You lunge at the man, and Dagr intercepts you. Years of training allow him to block your attacks without even scratching you in return.=/
[rugga] "Do better. Or these people will run you off."
[rugga] "Don't get quiet now, Rook. You speak up when a decision needs to be made, but get quiet when that choice goes south?"
[rugga] "I know you did, girl. But trying and failing is still just failing. That's a hard truth."
[rugga] "I'll let it go today, Rook, but someday, all these people won't."
[rugga] "I think we lost people today. Regardless of whether that was because of you, it falls on you."
[rugga] "Makes you wonder, doesn't it? You wonder if saving Ettingbekr would have stopped this fire."
[rugga] "Makes you wonder, doesn't it? You wonder if saving Ettingbekr would have stopped this fire."
[rugga] "Maybe. Maybe not. It doesn't matter though, does it? When lives are lost, you're blamed."
[rugga] "Of course. We're just supposed to cope with the results of your choices, not talk about them."
/=Rugga shares a look with Dagr and chuckles.=/
[rugga] "That's enough."
/=The governor and his guard stare at you from across a charred and fallen tree.=/
/=The governor and his guard step over a charred and fallen log to stand by your side.=/
[rugga] "They get to talk about their feelings. You get to learn quickly and lead."
[rugga] "This doesn't look good, you know? People are saying you could've saved Ettingbekr and prevented this."

content.option: "There was no way to see this coming."
"I feel bad enough without talking about it."

content: [rugga] "You want to be a leader? Stop talking about your feelings."
{skip} mark1=$hero mark2=rugga mark4=dagr
/=You leave the governor and his guard and help Eyvind and Juno with the wounded.=/
/=You pull away from Dagr, angrier than before.=/
/=You turn your back on him and get to the head of the caravan.=/
